question: How can I attach additional files to standard XML in Public Cloud?
answer:
To attach additional files to the standard XML in Public Cloud, you can use the Business Add-In (BAdI) EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD and enhance the XML file generated for an electronic document.
By enhancing the XML file, you can include additional information that may be relevant for your business processes .
To implement this enhancement, you can follow these steps in ABAP Development Tools (ADT):
1. In your ABAP project, go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD and select 'New BAdI Enhancement Implementation'.
2. Enter a package, name, and description for the implementation.
3. Choose 'Add BAdI Implementation' and select EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD .
4. (Optional) Create a BAdI filter for Country and/or Generic Filter.
5. Choose 'Implementing Class' to create a new implementation class.
6. Activate your BAdI implementation .
Once you have implemented the BAdI, you can fill the XML tag <BuyersItemIdentification> with the desired additional information.
This can be done by reading the relevant data from the source documents and filling the appropriate XML tags.
Please note that the specific implementation details may vary depending on your system setup and requirements.
It is recommended to refer to the provided sources for more detailed instructions and examples.
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Develop (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: You can attach additional files to standard XML in Public Cloud by using the Business Add-In (BAdI) EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD.
Enhancing the XML file generated for an electronic document allows inclusion of additional information.
The enhancement is implemented in ABAP Development Tools (ADT) via the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD.
You need to create a new BAdI Enhancement Implementation in your ABAP project.
You must select EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD when adding the BAdI Implementation.
You can optionally create a BAdI filter for Country and/or Generic Filter.
After implementing the BAdI, you can fill the XML tag <BuyersItemIdentification> with additional information.
Filling the XML tag can be done by reading relevant data from source documents.

question: For a Greece customer in Public Cloud, what are the steps to enhance the generated XML before sending it to the Tax Authorities using ADT?
answer:
To enhance the generated XML file for a Greece customer in Public Cloud before sending it to the Tax Authorities using ABAP Development Tools (ADT), you can follow these steps:
1. In your ABAP project, go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD (path: package GLO-EDO > Enhancements > Enhancement Spots).
2. Right-click ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD and select New BAdI Enhancement Implementation .
3. Enter a package, name, and description for the implementation.
4. Choose Add BAdI Implementation and select EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD.
5. (Optional) Create a BAdI filter for Country and/or Generic Filter.
6. Choose Implementing Class to create a new implementation class. The new implementation class automatically implements the interfaces if_badi_interfaces and if_edoc_adaptor_cloud.7. After generating the class, open the interface method and press F3 to view its parameters. To display the documentation, press F2.
8. Implement the necessary logic in the method to modify the XML tags and fill optional XML tags with values such as customer material number or delivery number.9. Activate your BAdI implementation.When you display the XML file of the electronic document in the eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents app, you will see that the relevant XML tags are now filled with the desired values.Please note that the provided steps are specific to enhancing the XML file for a German customer in Public Cloud using ADT. The exact implementation may vary depending on the specific requirements and configurations of your system.
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Develop (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: To enhance the generated XML for a Greece customer in Public Cloud before sending it to the Tax Authorities, you use ABAP Development Tools (ADT).
You should go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD in your ABAP project.
You need to create a new BAdI Enhancement Implementation for ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD.
You select EDOC_ADAPTOR_CLOUD when adding the BAdI Implementation.
You can optionally create a BAdI filter for Country and/or Generic Filter.
You create an implementing class that automatically implements the interfaces if_badi_interfaces and if_edoc_adaptor_cloud.
You implement logic in the method to modify XML tags and fill optional XML tags with values such as customer material number or delivery number.
You must activate your BAdI implementation after making changes.
After enhancement, the relevant XML tags in the electronic document will be filled with the desired values when viewed in the eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents app.

question: Can you provide a sample implementation for IS_RELEVANT Method of BAdI EDCO_CLOUD_ADAPTOR to control eDocument creation in Public Cloud based on some conditions?
answer:
Yes, I can provide a sample implementation for the IS_RELEVANT method of BAdI EDCO_CLOUD_ADAPTOR to control eDocument creation in Public Cloud based on some conditions.
Here is an example implementation for the IS_RELEVANT method:
CLASS zcl_edoc_adaptor_cloud DEFINITION
  PUBLIC
  FINAL
  CREATE PUBLIC .
  PUBLIC SECTION.
    INTERFACES if_badi_interface .
    INTERFACES if_edoc_adaptor_cloud .
  PROTECTED SECTION.
  PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.
CLASS zcl_badi_edoc_adaptor_cloud IMPLEMENTATION.
  METHOD if_edoc_adaptor_cloud~is_relevant.
    DATA: lv_relevant TYPE abap_bool.
   
    Your conditions to control eDocument creation
    IF CONDITION.
      lv_relevant = abap_true.
    ELSE.
      lv_relevant = abap_false.
    ENDIF.
   
    rv_relevant = lv_relevant.
  ENDMETHOD.
ENDCLASS.
In this implementation, you can define your own conditions to control eDocument creation based on your requirements. If the conditions are met, set the lv_relevant variable to abap_true, otherwise set it to abap_false.
The rv_relevant parameter is used to return the value of lv_relevant to the calling program.

INTERFACES if_edoc_adaptor_cloud .
PROTECTED SECTION.
PRIVATE SECTION.
ENDCLASS.

METHOD if_edoc_adaptor_cloud~is_relevant.
CHECK iv_source_type = 'SD_INVOICE'. Source Type

question: What are the steps to develop new processes for electronic documents in the Electronic Document Processing framework in Public Cloud?
answer:
The Electronic Document Processing framework allows you to create electronic documents from documents created in source applications (for example, invoices created in Sales). The system extracts the relevant information from the invoice and creates an XML which is submitted to external services using a cloud service. For new processes, you develop in the following components:
1. The connected business process in your 3-system landscape system triggers the creation of an instance of an electronic document (eDocument).
2. The Electronic Document Processing framework itself.
3. On the backend systems, Electronic Document Processing framework leverages the Web Services Runtime.
4. On SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance uses SAP Integration Suite.
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Develop (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: The Electronic Document Processing framework allows creation of electronic documents from documents generated in source applications.
The system extracts relevant information from the source document and creates an XML.
The XML is submitted to external services using a cloud service.
To develop new processes, you must work with the connected business process in your 3-system landscape system, which triggers the creation of an eDocument instance.
You must develop within the Electronic Document Processing framework itself.
On backend systems, the Electronic Document Processing framework leverages the Web Services Runtime.
On SAP Business Technology Platform, SAP Document and Reporting Compliance uses SAP Integration Suite.

DATA(lo_edocument) = cl_edocument_ext_es=>retrieve_by_edoc_guid( EXPORTING iv_edoc_guid = edocument-edoc_guid iv_skip_interface_det = abap_true ). DATA(lt_edocumentfile) = lo_edocument->get_edoc_files( ). LOOP AT lt_edocumentfile INTO DATA(ls_edocumentfile) WHERE file_type = 'REQUEST' OR file_type = 'SEND_REQ' OR file_type = 'SEND_RESP'. ls_attachment-attachm_subject = ls_edocumentfile-file_name. ls_attachment-attachm_type = 'PDF'. DATA lp_offset TYPE i. DATA ls_solix_line TYPE edoc_attch_content_hex. DATA lp_pdf_string_len TYPE i. DATA lp_solix_rows TYPE i. DATA lp_last_row_length TYPE i. DATA lp_row_length TYPE i. lp_row_length = 255. lp_offset = 0. lp_pdf_string_len = xstrlen( ls_edocumentfile-file_raw ). lp_solix_rows = lp_pdf_string_len DIV lp_row_length. lp_last_row_length = lp_pdf_string_len MOD lp_row_length. DO lp_solix_rows TIMES. ls_solix_line-line = ls_edocumentfile-file_raw+lp_offset(lp_row_length). APPEND ls_solix_line TO ls_attachment-content_hex. ADD lp_row_length TO lp_offset. ENDDO. IF lp_last_row_length > 0. CLEAR ls_solix_line-line. ls_solix_line-line = ls_edocumentfile-file_raw+lp_offset(lp_last_row_length). APPEND ls_solix_line TO ls_attachment-content_hex. ENDIF. ls_attachment-attachm_size = xstrlen( ls_edocumentfile-file_raw ). APPEND ls_attachment TO attachments. ENDLOOP. CATCH cx_edocument_ext INTO DATA(lx_exception). ENDTRY. ENDMETHOD. ENDCLASS.
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

facts.fact: The provided code is an ABAP class implementation for enhancing customer E-Mail attachments.
The method if_edoc_change_email_v2~change_email_to_customer is used to modify the E-Mail sent to customers.
The code retrieves electronic document files using cl_edocument_ext_es=>retrieve_by_edoc_guid.
It loops through document files of type 'REQUEST', 'SEND_REQ', or 'SEND_RESP'.
For each relevant file, an attachment is created with the subject set to the file name.
The attachment type is set to 'PDF'.
The file content is split into 255-byte chunks and added to the attachment content.
The attachment size is set to the length of the file content.
The attachment is appended to the attachments table to be included in the E-Mail.

question: For a Greece customer in Private Cloud, what are the steps to enhance the generated XML before sending it to the Tax Authorities using ADT?
answer:
To enhance the generated XML file for a Greece customer in Private Cloud before sending it to the Tax Authorities using ABAP Development Tools (ADT), you can follow these steps:
1. In your ABAP project, go to the enhancement spot ES_EDOCUMENT (path: package GLO-EDO > Enhancements > Enhancement Spots).
2. Right-click ES_EDOCUMENT_CLOUD and select New BAdI Enhancement Implementation .
3. Enter a package, name, and description for the implementation.
4. Choose Add BAdI Implementation and select EDOC_ADAPTOR.
5. (Optional) Create a BAdI filter for Country and/or Generic Filter.
6. Choose Implementing Class to create a new implementation class. The new implementation class automatically implements the interfaces if_badi_interfaces and if_edoc_adaptor_cloud.
7. After generating the class, open the interface method and press F3 to view its parameters. To display the documentation, press F2.
8. Implement the necessary logic in the method to modify the XML tags and fill optional XML tags with values such as customer material number or delivery number.
9. Activate your BAdI implementation. When you display the XML file of the electronic document in the eDocument Cockpit or Manage Electronic Documents app, you will see that the relevant XML tags are now filled with the desired values. Please note that the provided steps are specific to enhancing the XML file for a German customer in Public Cloud using ADT. The exact implementation may vary depending on the specific requirements and configurations of your system.

category: How to Develop (Maintenance - Customer case support)

question: In Public Cloud CE2602, I want to enhance the e-mail sent out from the Manage Electronic Document app to customers. What Processes or countries has this extensibility feature enabled?
answer: In Public Cloud CE2602, the BAdI Implementation EDOC_PART_CONN_CHANGE_EMAIL_V2 for enhancing outgoing e-mails to customer is available to all countries who have enabled the Send to Customer functionality for a process in the eDocument Cockpit. The extensibility feature is not linked to countries, its linked to eDocument processes instead.
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

facts.fact: In Public Cloud CE2602, the BAdI Implementation EDOC_PART_CONN_CHANGE_EMAIL_V2 is used for enhancing outgoing e-mails to customers.
The extensibility feature for enhancing outgoing e-mails is available to all countries that have enabled the 'Send to Customer' functionality for a process in the eDocument Cockpit.
The extensibility feature is linked to eDocument processes, not to countries.

answer: You need to assign invoice verification transactions to eDocument types properly after you implement the latest Notes. We noticed that the assignment for Subsequent Credit is missing in your system. C/R Country/Region Name Transaction eDocument Type Type Description MY Malaysia Invoice MY_INVSF Malaysia Buyer-Issued Invoice MY Malaysia Credit Memo MY_CRESF Malaysia Buyer-Issued Crd Memo MY Malaysia Subsequent Debit MY_DEBSF Malaysia Buyer-Issued Dbt Memo MY Malaysia Subsequent Credit MY_CRESF Malaysia Buyer-Issued Crd Memo For more details, please refer to the link below: Assigning eDocument Type to Invoice Verification Transaction | SAP Help Portal

facts.fact: Invoice verification transactions must be assigned to eDocument types after implementing the latest SAP Notes.
The assignment for Subsequent Credit is missing in the user's system.
For Malaysia, the eDocument type for Subsequent Credit should be MY_CRESF (Malaysia Buyer-Issued Crd Memo).
The eDocument type for Invoice in Malaysia is MY_INVSF (Malaysia Buyer-Issued Invoice).
The eDocument type for Credit Memo in Malaysia is MY_CRESF (Malaysia Buyer-Issued Crd Memo).
The eDocument type for Subsequent Debit in Malaysia is MY_DEBSF (Malaysia Buyer-Issued Dbt Memo).
More details can be found in the SAP Help Portal under 'Assigning eDocument Type to Invoice Verification Transaction'.

question: MY E-Invoice_Error in Tourism tax --- Product/Function --- User selected product: SAP ERP (Recommended & Recent) User selected product function: SAP ERP > Country/Region Specific Functionality > Malaysia > eDocument - Malysia (Recent) Predicted component: CA-GTF-CSC-EDO-MY (Product Function) Predicted product: SAP enhancement package for SAP ERP User selected product function: SAP enhancement package for SAP ERP > Country/Region Specific Functionality > Malaysia > eDocument - Malysia (Recent) Predicted component: CA-GTF-CSC-EDO-MY (Product Function) --- Steps to Reproduce --- *Note To SAP: I give approval for SAP Support to use these Steps to Reproduce, while connected to my impacted non-production environments, even if the steps result in a change being made and my approval remains valid until the issue is resolved, unless I inform SAP Support otherwise. --- Description --- Hi, We have maintained NA for Tourism Tax in OBY6. But the node for Tourism Tax is not found in XML n1:AccountingSupplierParty. This resulted in an error during XML validation.
answer: As mentioned in the SDK you shared to us and in the live URL, TTX is only mandatory for tourism tax registrant. Test result shows that if TTX is hided for none-tourism tax registrant, and without NA display in the xml for TTX, the eDocument could be valided by LHDN. So not showing NA is not a violation to the government requirement. SAP solution hide the node for better file size as recommended by LHDN( Additional considerations). But if you would like to show NA if there is some specific requirement from your side, please implement BADI EDOC_ADAPTOR~SET_OUTPUT_DATA.
product: ERP (excluding SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: Initial error explanation and cause analysis (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: TTX is only mandatory for tourism tax registrant.
If TTX is hidden for non-tourism tax registrant and NA is not displayed in the XML for TTX, the eDocument can be validated by LHDN.
Not showing NA is not a violation of the government requirement.
SAP solution hides the node for better file size as recommended by LHDN.
If there is a specific requirement to show NA, BADI EDOC_ADAPTOR~SET_OUTPUT_DATA should be implemented.

question: einvoice version 1.0 to 1.1 --- Product/Function --- User selected product: SAP ERP (Recommended & Recent) User selected product function: SAP ERP > Country/Region Specific Functionality > Malaysia > eDocument - Malysia (Recommended & Recent) Predicted component: CA-GTF-CSC-EDO-MY (Product Function) --- TagID/AreaID --- TagID: EC2 AreaID: 00109B36D6221EDBB0C0294B42EA40E8 --- Description --- Hi, Could you please share the SAP Note details to update the einvoice from 1.0 to 1.1
answer:
Regarding Einvoice version 1.1 Please find below findings.
SAP Note 3498572 is available for all releases. Previously, it was released for SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 and SAP S/4HANA 2021 only.
Document type version 1.1 is now supported by SAP. See the 'Note About Digital Signatures' section.
Note About Digital Signatures
The validation of digital signatures is supported by document type version 1.1 only. You must use this version if you want to have your digital signatures validated. See the following documentation:
SAP S/4HANA: Specifying a Document Type Version (INVOICE_VERSION)
SAP ERP: Specifying a Document Type Version (INVOICE_VERSION)
The only difference is that signature validation is enabled on v1.1, no further change from our side, customer can just change the configuration to test v1.1
Find below link for further clarifications.
https: //sdk.myinvois.hasil.gov.my/types/
product: ERP (excluding SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Configure (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: SAP Note 3498572 is available for all releases.
SAP Note 3498572 was previously released for SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 and SAP S/4HANA 2021 only.
Document type version 1.1 is now supported by SAP.
Validation of digital signatures is supported only by document type version 1.1.
You must use document type version 1.1 if you want digital signatures validated.
In SAP S/4HANA, specifying a document type version is done using INVOICE_VERSION.
In SAP ERP, specifying a document type version is done using INVOICE_VERSION.
The only difference in version 1.1 is that signature validation is enabled.
No further change is required from SAP's side for version 1.1; customers can change the configuration to test v1.1.

question: --- Steps to Reproduce --- Step 1: Create Invoice in MIRO Step 2: Submit to invoice in DRC - sending to service requested( special characters are not allowed for reference number of customs form. ) --- Description --- Dear SAP Support, There is an issue detected that the PDF & XML cannot be displayed because the application log stated that special characters are not allowed for reference number of customs form. Custom logic: Grab from MIGO header text for custom form After checking notice that it grab from the PO header text but we did not maintain the any value in (IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE)
answer: If no fix value maintained for IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE, then system will read text using text ID F01 from PO since customs form is mandatory field requested by Government. lv_id = get_fix_value( EXPORTING iv_name = 'IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE' iv_err_msg_ind = abap_false ). IF lv_id IS INITIAL. "Header Text lv_id = 'F01'. ENDIF. Please make sure no special characters maintained in PO text(text ID F01 ). Or maintain fix value for IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE to read text from other text field. Or changing value using BADI EDOC_ADAPTOR~SET_OUTPUT_DATA Fill or change eDocument data after mapping.
product: ERP (excluding SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: Initial error explanation and cause analysis (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: If no fix value is maintained for IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE, the system reads text using text ID F01 from the PO.
Customs form is a mandatory field requested by the Government.
The system uses get_fix_value to check for a fix value for IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE.
If lv_id is initial, the system sets lv_id to 'F01'.
No special characters should be maintained in PO text with text ID F01.
A fix value for IMPORT_TEXT_TYPE can be maintained to read text from another text field.
The value can be changed using BADI EDOC_ADAPTOR~SET_OUTPUT_DATA.
eDocument data can be filled or changed after mapping.

question: SOA Manager configuration was also switched. during the smoke test user reported below issue: After switching CO_DCS_DCP_GENERIC_WEBSERVICE to preview the HTML in the PEPPOL scenario to SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, cloud edition on BTP Cloud Foundry we are facing the following error after trying Display  HTML:
answer:
Based on the provided information, it appears that the wrong logical port and URL path have been determined for the CO_DCS_DCP_GENERIC_WEBSERVICE in the SOA Manager configuration. The incorrect URL path that has been determined is '/cxf/PeppolLookup', which is causing the error when trying to display HTML. We assume this comes from the currently registered logical port in EDOSOASERV.
To resolve this issue, the correct logical port and URL path need to be determined and updated in the SOA Manager configuration. The correct logical port to be maintained is 'EDO_DCS_DCP_GENERC_WEBSERVICE'.
Please follow these steps:
1. Access SAP and navigate to 'SM30 -> EDOSOASERV (Defining SOA Services for Communication)'.
2. Search for 'EU_GENERIC_WEBSERV' and specify 'EDO_DCS_DCP_GENERC_WEBSERVICE'.
3. Check the URL path for the logical port 'CO_DCS_DCP_GENERIC_WEBSERVICE' / 'EDO_DCS_DCP_GENERC_WEBSERVICE' in the SOA Manager configuration with the correct URL path from https: //help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/creating-logical-ports-in-soa-management-sap-s-4hana-network-exchange
Once the correct logical port and URL path have been determined and updated, the issue with generating HTML should be resolved.
product: ERP (excluding SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: Initial error explanation and cause analysis (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: The wrong logical port and URL path have been determined for CO_DCS_DCP_GENERIC_WEBSERVICE in the SOA Manager configuration.
The incorrect URL path determined is '/cxf/PeppolLookup'.
The incorrect URL path is causing the error when trying to display HTML.
The incorrect logical port appears to come from the currently registered logical port in EDOSOASERV.
To resolve the issue, the correct logical port and URL path need to be determined and updated in the SOA Manager configuration.
The correct logical port to be maintained is 'EDO_DCS_DCP_GENERC_WEBSERVICE'.
Once the correct logical port and URL path have been determined and updated, the issue with generating HTML should be resolved.
You should check the URL path for the logical port 'CO_DCS_DCP_GENERIC_WEBSERVICE' / 'EDO_DCS_DCP_GENERC_WEBSERVICE' in the SOA Manager configuration with the correct URL path from SAP documentation.

question: Incoming ZUGFeRD invoices (from suppliers) we load in the eDocument Cockpit using the PUSH SOAP Service DCPPUSHSERVICE . We have an own development to extract the XML attached in the PDF A/3 and load this in the eCockpit. That works very good. The question is what we do with the PDF itself. According to the service documentation of SOAP service DCPPUSHSERVICE we can add HTML version of the XML or PDF as attachments. We tried boths and both is working. But in eDocument Cockpit we  have for incoming edocuments only a buttoon to display HTML. How can we display the PDF that originally represents the ZUGFeRD invoice?
answer:
Here are some hints that might be helpful. We haven't tried out those yet, but it may be worth to give it a try.
extend EDOPROCFUNCASGV as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal
extend EDOPROCFUNCARCV as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal
alternatively, consider to override the HTML Display Function using some custom logic, e.g. show a follow-up Popup that let's the user decide whether the HTML or PDF shall be displayed or not - EDOACTIONUIPROCV as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal
You'll find some screenshots, including the Display PDF Action implementation for the Outgoing E-Mail Process
product: ERP (excluding SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Develop (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: You can extend EDOPROCFUNCASGV as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal.
You can extend EDOPROCFUNCARCV as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal.
You can override the HTML Display Function using custom logic to allow users to choose between HTML or PDF display.
EDOACTIONUIPROCV can be used for overriding the HTML Display Function as indicated in Configure the eDocument Cockpit | SAP Help Portal.
There are screenshots available showing the Display PDF Action implementation for the Outgoing E-Mail Process.

question:
We as Syntax are currently implementing SAP DRC and are following the official SAP help.
We are currently at the step Integration of Peppol Exchange with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and there at the creation of an S/4HANA Public Cloud communication user.
A client certificate should be uploaded for the communication user to be created, as Basic Auth (via user + password) is not supported.
The problem: We do not have this certificate. Where can I get this certificate? What format must it be in?
We are stuck at this step because we are missing the certificate mentioned and it is also not clear to us what kind of certificate is meant here and where to get it.
answer:
1. In the BTP Subaccount, go to Connectivity -> Destination and go to 'Certificates'
Choose 'Generate New Certificate'
Certificate Name - any meaningful name
File Extension 'PFX'
Remember the Password
Select the new certificate in your destination to the backend system and provide Authentication 'Internet' and 'ClientCertificateAuthentication'
 your Certificate needs to be selected in 'Key Store Location'
Provide the Password from above.
Save the Destination
Export the private certificate as PFX fileo
Verify the path of your Destination, according to Creating Communication Arrangements | SAP Help Portal , ...Inbound Communication > Inbound Services | The system automatically creates the service URL when you create the communication arrangement. You must enter this URL in the Destination in SAP BTP. See Setting Up
Connectivity....
2. Open the certificate locally and import to your PC's key storeo
 provide your password when askedo
go to your local PC's Key Store ('Manage User Certificates' in Windows)
find your certificate and export it to your local drive
do not export the private key
3.  In S/4 HANA Cloud Switch to your Communication System with Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0529 (the current Communication system for Peppol Exchange)
upload the certificate to your existing Communication User
product: ERP (only SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
category: How to Configure (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: The client certificate can be generated in the BTP Subaccount under Connectivity -> Destination -> Certificates.
You should choose 'Generate New Certificate' to create the certificate.
The certificate file extension must be 'PFX'.
You need to remember the password set during certificate generation.
The new certificate must be selected in your destination to the backend system with Authentication set to 'Internet' and 'ClientCertificateAuthentication'.
The certificate needs to be selected in 'Key Store Location' in the destination settings.
You must provide the password from certificate generation when configuring the destination.
The private certificate should be exported as a PFX file.
The certificate should be uploaded to your existing Communication User in S/4HANA Cloud under the Communication System with Communication Scenario SAP_COM_0529.

question: We have an S4/Hana system and an IS-U system with two clients In both systems, we work with the same companies, which means that each company has one per system. We use the VAT ID for participant-ID. If we try to create it with the same participant-ID, we get an error because of the same VAT-ID in our participant-ID.
answer: Based on the information provided, it seems that the core of the problem is the duplication of VAT IDs used as participant IDs across different systems (S4/Hana and IS-U) for the same company, which is causing conflicts. Instead of using VAT IDs, consider using a more flexible identifier such as the Global Location Number (GLN). GLNs can be used across different systems without causing conflicts. This approach is particularly useful when you have multiple systems or company codes that need to be uniquely identified. For more details on this question, please refer to Peppol IDs in the context of SAP Document Complian... - SAP Community .
product: Peppol Service on Business Technology Platform
category: How to Configure (Maintenance - Customer case support)

facts.fact: The S4/Hana system and the IS-U system each have two clients.
Each company exists in both the S4/Hana and IS-U systems.
The VAT ID is used as the participant-ID in both systems.
Creating a participant with the same participant-ID (VAT ID) in both systems results in an error.
The error is caused by duplication of VAT IDs used as participant IDs across different systems.
Using a more flexible identifier such as the Global Location Number (GLN) is recommended instead of VAT IDs.
GLNs can be used across different systems without causing conflicts.
Using GLNs is particularly useful when multiple systems or company codes need to be uniquely identified.

question: Customer reports that the document is stuck in 'Received by sender access point'. The Document Monitor says:  HTTP response '401: Unauthorized. <html><head><meta http-equiv='content-type' content='text/html; charset=windows-1252'><title>Anmeldung fehlgeschlagen</title><style>body { background: #ffffff; text-align: center; width:100%; height:100%; overflow:hidden; }.content { display: table; position:absolute; width:100%; height:80%; }.valigned { display: table-cell; vertical-align: middle; }.lowerCenter { display: table-cell; vertical-align: bottom; }.footer { position: absolute; bottom: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; z-index: -1; }.footerLeft { float: left; margin-left: 20px; }.footerRight { float: right; margin-right: 20px; position: absolute; bottom: 0px; right: 0px; }.centerText { font-style: normal; font-family: Arial; font-size: 26px; color: #444444; z-index: 1; }.errorTextHeader { font-style: normal; font-family: Arial; font-size: 40px; color: #444444; }.bottomText { align: center; f...
answer:
The error message 'HTTP response '401: Unauthorized' indicates that the document is stuck in the 'Received by sender access point' status due to unauthorized access [[2]](https://drcce-architecture-ai.b217766.stage.kyma.ondemand.com/api/v1/forward_to_source?source_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.wdf.sap.corp%2Fslh-dc-platform%2Fpeppol-service-support-documentation%2Fblob%2Fmain%2Fsrc%2Fmd%2FPush%2520Response%2520is%2520not%2520received%2520or%2520processed%2520in%2520the%2520Backend.md%23push-response-not-processed---edocument-is-stuck-in-received-by-sender-access-point-or-request-acknowledged-yellow-indicator-cf&response_session_id=95cfefe1-d8c3-4f5f-80cd-4302e701507d&chunk_id=81afe245-08ff-43ac-a10a-c58edb6c915f&is_inline_source=True). This error occurs when the customer is using an S/4 HANA Public Cloud backend and there is an issue with the authentication method and certificates [[1]](https://drcce-architecture-ai.b217766.stage.kyma.ondemand.com/api/v1/forward_to_source?source_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.wdf.sap.corp%2Fslh-dc-platform%2Fpeppol-service-support-documentation%2Fblob%2Fmain%2Fsrc%2Fmd%2FPush%2520Response%2520is%2520not%2520received%2520or%2520processed%2520in%2520the%2520Backend.md%23submitting-the-document-stuck-in-sending-requested-s4-hana-on-premise--erp&response_session_id=95cfefe1-d8c3-4f5f-80cd-4302e701507d&chunk_id=e39664e7-c70d-4894-b2d0-4d6c3743adba&is_inline_source=True).
To resolve this issue, the customer needs to ensure proper communication between SAP DRC and S/4 HANA Cloud by setting up the correct authentication method and certificates [[1]](https: //drcce-architecture-ai.b217766.stage.kyma.ondemand.com/api/v1/forward_to_source?source_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.wdf.sap.corp%2Fslh-dc-platform%2Fpeppol-service-support-documentation%2Fblob%2Fmain%2Fsrc%2Fmd%2FPush%2520Response%2520is%2520not%2520received%2520or%2520processed%2520in%2520the%2520Backend.md%23submitting-the-document-stuck-in-sending-requested-s4-hana-on-premise--erp&response_session_id=95cfefe1-d8c3-4f5f-80cd-4302e701507d&chunk_id=e39664e7-c70d-4894-b2d0-4d6c3743adba&is_inline_source=True). facts.fact: The error message 'HTTP response 401: Unauthorized' indicates unauthorized access.
The document is stuck in the 'Received by sender access point' status due to unauthorized access.
This error occurs when the customer is using an S/4 HANA Public Cloud backend and there is an issue with the authentication method and certificates.
To resolve the issue, the customer needs to set up the correct authentication method and certificates for communication between SAP DRC and S/4 HANA Cloud.
The customer should check if the necessary SAP Notes are installed, especially those mentioned in the troubleshooting guide.
If issues persist, the customer can consider resubmitting the document after ensuring all configurations and prerequisites are correctly set up.
The customer can access the Document Monitor to get detailed information on the MPL ID and error message.
If information is not available in the Document Monitor, the customer can search for the Sender Participant ID in the internal tool Peppol Admin to identify the environment.

question: Which steps do I have to do in order to enable source type "Settlement Management Documents" for the France eInoivce eDocument Process so that eDocuments are getting created and the mapping is enhanced?
answer:
To create eDocuments for Settlement Management Documents for the France eInvoicing eDocument process, you need to do the following steps:
- Make the Settlement Management Documents become relevant in method IS_RELEVANT of class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV
- Enhance the method DETERMINE_PROCESS in class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV to determine the process type
- Enhance the method DETERMINE_PAYMENT_PROCESS in class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV to determine the payment process for Settlement Documents

To enable the mapping for Settlement Management Documents for the France eInvoicing eDocument process, you need to create a class, e.g. CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT, which inherits from the billing document mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_SD.
The following methods need to be redefined from the supperclass:
- FILL_BILLING_REFERENCE
- FILL_CONTRACT_REFERENCE
- FILL_DELIVERY
- FILL_INVOICE_TYPE_CODE
- FILL_NOTE
- FILL_ORDER_REFERENCE
- FILL_PRICE_AMOUNT
- READ_CODES_FROM_HEADER_TEXT

To trigger the mapping class you have created, the following entries have to be inserted into view Mapping Class Determination for Interface ID in transaction EDOP and transported:
0001       FR_INV_CREDIT_NOTE_REQUEST      FR_EUCRE    STLMT_INV    CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT    O Outbound
0001       FR_INV_INVOICE_REQUEST          FR_EUINV    STLMT_INV    CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT       O Outbound
product: ERP

facts.fact: Settlement Management Documents must be made relevant in method IS_RELEVANT of class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV.
Method DETERMINE_PROCESS in class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV must be enhanced to determine the process type.
Method DETERMINE_PAYMENT_PROCESS in class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV must be enhanced to determine the payment process for Settlement Documents.
A new mapping class (e.g., CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT) inheriting from CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_SD must be created to enable mapping for Settlement Management Documents.

The following methods must be redefined in the new mapping class: FILL_BILLING_REFERENCE, FILL_CONTRACT_REFERENCE, FILL_DELIVERY, FILL_INVOICE_TYPE_CODE, FILL_NOTE, FILL_ORDER_REFERENCE, FILL_PRICE_AMOUNT, READ_CODES_FROM_HEADER_TEXT.
Entries for the new mapping class must be inserted into the view Mapping Class Determination for Interface ID in transaction EDOP and transported.

Example entries for the mapping class include: 0001 FR_INV_CREDIT_NOTE_REQUEST FR_EUCRE STLMT_INV CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT O Outbound and 0001 FR_INV_INVOICE_REQUEST FR_EUINV STLMT_INV CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT O Outbound.

question: I want to see, how the enablement for source type "Settlement Management Documents" for the France eInoivce eDocument Process is implemented, so that eDocuments are getting created and the mapping is enhanced. To make the Settlement Management Documents become relevant, I need to adjust the method IS_RELEVANT of class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV. Please show me the code where this happens.
answer:
First you need to make the Settlement Management Documents become relevant in method IS_RELEVANT of class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV

 METHOD is_relevant.
    DATA: lv_bukrs_land    TYPE land1.

    IF  mo_source->mv_source_type <>
        cl_edoc_source_sd_invoice=>gc_src_sd_invoice
       AND  mo_source->mv_source_type <>
        cl_edoc_source_fi_invoice=>gc_src_fi_invoice
       AND mo_source->mv_source_type <>
        cl_edoc_source_invoice_verif=>gc_src_inv_verif
       AND mo_source->mv_source_type <>
        cl_edoc_source_stlmt=>gc_src_stlmt_inv.
*       AND mo_source->mv_source_type <>                     "3428018
*        cl_edoc_source_ext_doc=>gc_src_ext_doc.             "3428018
      rv_relevant = abap_false.
      RETURN.
    ENDIF.

    rv_relevant = abap_true.

    IF rv_relevant = abap_true.
*     For Cancellations the eDocument should not be created
*     If the original document has been reversed the eDocument should not be created
      IF mo_source->is_cancelled( ) = abap_true OR         "Is the source document already cancelled?
        mo_source->is_cancellation( ) = abap_true.         "Is a Cancellation?
        rv_relevant = abap_false.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.

    IF mo_adaptor IS BOUND.
      mo_adaptor->if_edoc_adaptor~is_relevant(
                     EXPORTING io_source   = mo_source
                     CHANGING  cx_relevant = rv_relevant ).
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.
product: ERP

facts.fact: The enablement for source type 'Settlement Management Documents' is implemented in the method IS_RELEVANT of class CL_EDOCUMENT_FR_INV.
The method IS_RELEVANT checks if mo_source->mv_source_type equals cl_edoc_source_stlmt=>gc_src_stlmt_inv to determine relevance for Settlement Management Documents.
If mo_source->mv_source_type does not match any of the allowed source types, including Settlement Management Documents, rv_relevant is set to abap_false and the method returns.
If the source document is cancelled or is a cancellation, rv_relevant is set to abap_false.
If mo_adaptor is bound, the method calls mo_adaptor->if_edoc_adaptor~is_relevant to further determine relevance.
The provided code snippet shows the implementation of the IS_RELEVANT method for enabling Settlement Management Documents in the France eInvoice eDocument Process.

question: To enable source type "Settlement Management Documents" for the France B2B eInoivce eDocument Process, to create the mapping, I need to create a class, e.g. CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT, which inherits from the billing document mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_SD. How could the code for this class look like?
answer:
To create the mapping, you need to create a class, e.g. CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT, which inherits from the billing document mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_SD.
The method FILL_BILLING_REFERENCE needs to be redefined from the supperclass and enhanced:
  METHOD fill_billing_reference.

    DATA: ls_invoice_document_reference TYPE edo_fr_inv_invoice_document_re,
          lt_wbrf                       TYPE wbrf_tab,
          ls_wbrf                       TYPE wbrf.

    IF ms_source-komlfk-lfaks IS NOT INITIAL.
*     Reversed Document
      ls_invoice_document_reference-id-base-content = ms_source-komlfk-lfaks.
      ls_invoice_document_reference-issue_date-content = ms_source-komlfk-wfdat.
      APPEND ls_invoice_document_reference TO rs_billing_reference-invoice_document_reference.

    ELSE.
*     Document flow - read the preceding document
      CALL FUNCTION 'WLF_DOCUMENT_FLOW_READ_LFTYPN'
        EXPORTING
          i_wbelnn              = ms_source-komlfk-wbeln
          i_lftypn              = ms_source-komlfk-lftyp
          i_get_all_predecessor = abap_true
        IMPORTING
          et_wbrf               = lt_wbrf
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS                = 1.
      IF sy-subrc EQ 0.
        ##INTO_OK
        LOOP AT lt_wbrf INTO ls_wbrf.
          ls_invoice_document_reference-id-base-content =  ls_wbrf-wbelnv.
          ls_invoice_document_reference-issue_date-content = ls_wbrf-erdat.
          APPEND ls_invoice_document_reference TO rs_billing_reference-invoice_document_reference.
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDIF.

    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.
product: ERP

The new class should be named, for example, CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT.
CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_STLMT must inherit from the billing document mapping class CL_EDOC_MAP_FR_B2B_SD.
The method FILL_BILLING_REFERENCE needs to be redefined in the new class.
The redefined FILL_BILLING_REFERENCE method should enhance the superclass implementation.

If ms_source-komlfk-lfaks is not initial, the method sets ls_invoice_document_reference-id-base-content to ms_source-komlfk-lfaks and ls_invoice_document_reference-issue_date-content to ms_source-komlfk-wfdat.
If ms_source-komlfk-lfaks is initial, the method calls function 'WLF_DOCUMENT_FLOW_READ_LFTYPN' to read the preceding document.
For each entry in lt_wbrf, the method sets ls_invoice_document_reference-id-base-content to ls_wbrf-wbelnv and ls_invoice_document_reference-issue_date-content to ls_wbrf-erdat.

          lt_text   TYPE TABLE OF tline,
          ls_text   TYPE tline,
          ls_note   LIKE LINE OF rt_note.

*   Get the Text ID for the Settlement Management Document Header
*     (go to Header -> Details -> Accounting tab page of the document)
    SELECT SINGLE tdid_hs1
      INTO lv_tdid
      FROM tmfk
      WHERE lfart = ms_source-komlfk-lfart.
    IF sy-subrc = 0.
*     Text object = document number
      lv_tdname = ms_source-vbrk-vbeln.
*     Read the text from the source document
      lt_text = read_text(
        iv_langu    = sy-langu
        iv_tdid     = lv_tdid
        iv_tdname   = lv_tdname
        iv_tdobject = 'WBRK' ).

      IF lt_text IS NOT INITIAL.
        ##INTO_OK
        LOOP AT lt_text INTO ls_text.
          ls_note-base-content = ls_text-tdline.
          APPEND ls_note TO rt_note.
        ENDLOOP.
      ENDIF.

    ELSE.
*     Document header text of the related accounting document
      ls_note-base-content = ms_source-bkpf-bktxt.
      APPEND ls_note TO rt_note.
    ENDIF.

  ENDMETHOD.

question: To enable source type "Settlement Management Documents" for the France B2B eInoivce eDocument Process, the method FILL_PRICE_AMOUNT needs to be redefined from the supperclass and enhanced. How could the code for this look like?
answer:
The method FILL_PRICE_AMOUNT needs to be redefined from the supperclass and enhanced:
  METHOD fill_price_amount.

    DATA: lv_unit_price TYPE p DECIMALS 5,
          lv_dec        TYPE i,
          lv_dec_val    TYPE c LENGTH 7,
          lv_unit_quan  TYPE c LENGTH 4 VALUE '1000',
          lv_price      TYPE kwert.

    CLEAR ev_unit_quan.
    IF is_vbrp-fkimg IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_unit_price = is_vbrp-netwr / is_vbrp-fkimg.
    ELSE.
      lv_unit_price = is_vbrp-netwr.
    ENDIF.

    IF lv_unit_price IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_unit_price = abs( lv_unit_price ).
      lv_dec_val = frac( lv_unit_price ).
      CONDENSE lv_dec_val.
      SHIFT lv_dec_val LEFT BY 2 PLACES.
      lv_dec = strlen( lv_dec_val ).
      IF lv_dec GT 2.
        lv_dec = lv_dec - 1.
        ev_unit_quan = lv_unit_quan+0(lv_dec).
        lv_unit_price = lv_unit_price * lv_unit_quan.
        lv_price = lv_unit_price.
        ev_price_amount = lv_price.
      ELSE.
        lv_price = lv_unit_price.
        ev_price_amount = lv_price.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
    format_negative_amount( CHANGING cv_amount = ev_price_amount ).

    ev_currency = ms_source-vbrk-waerk.

  ENDMETHOD.
product: ERP

  method READ_CODES_FROM_HEADER_TEXT.

    lt_text = read_text(

      iv_tdname   = lv_tdname
      iv_tdobject = 'WBRK' ).

    IF lt_text IS NOT INITIAL.
      ##INTO_OK
      LOOP AT lt_text INTO ls_text.
        CONCATENATE lv_header_text ls_text-tdline INTO lv_header_text.
      ENDLOOP.
      ms_party_receiver-addressing_line_code = lv_header_text.
      CLEAR lv_header_text.
    ENDIF.
  endmethod.
